keywords.value: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The expiration of the 421-a tax subsidy could undermine Mayor Bill de Blasio’s efforts to spur the construction of affordable housing through a citywide zoning shift.

headline.print_headline: End of Subsidy May Threaten Impact of Shift in City Zoning
headline.main: End of Tax Break Program May Blunt Impact of New York Zoning Change

snippet: The expiration of the 421-a tax subsidy could undermine Mayor Bill de Blasio’s efforts to spur the construction of affordable housing through a citywide zoning shift.
abstract: Zoning reform deal reached by New York City Council, integral part of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s affordable housing plan, is meant to work together with 421-a property tax exemption, which has expired and can only be reinstated by State Legislature; without exemption, city will have to spend more on housing or fall short of goal.
